meanings.sent1: The ship followed the rumbo towards the island.
meanings.sent2: He pointed to the north rumbo on the map.
meanings.sent3: The lost hiker found his rumbo and finally reached home.
meanings.sent4: Her rumbo in life led her to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent5: The rumbo of the river twisted and turned through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The sailor checked the rumbo on the compass before setting sail.
meanings.sent2: The rumbo of the compass needle pointed north.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to change the rumbo on the compass.
meanings.sent4: His moral rumbo always guided him in times of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The rumbo of the compass always showed the right way home.

meanings.definition: To set or be on a course or direction
meanings.sent1: They rumboed towards the mountains for their hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: She rumboed her boat towards the setting sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat rumboed around the house, chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His dreams rumboed towards a bright future full of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The car rumboed down the highway, leaving a trail of dust behind.
